alert.note: Alert for Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 27 at 10:45AM CDT until June 27 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT FOR HASKELL...EASTERN MCINTOSH...WESTERN SEQUOYAH...NORTHWESTERN LATIMER...NORTHEASTERN PITTSBURG AND MUSKOGEE COUNTIES... At 1045 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 2 miles northwest of Gore to 2 miles south of Whitefield to 6 miles northeast of Alderson, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Mcalester... Sallisaw... Eufaula... Stigler... Checotah... Krebs... Warner... Vian... Quinton... Gore... Porum... Webbers Falls... Keota... Crowder... Whitefield... Oktaha... Kinta... Marble City... Braggs... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 257 and 303. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tulsa.
